benefits.title: Beneficial effects of Lepidium meyenii (Maca) on psychological symptoms and measures of sexual dysfunction in postmenopausal women are not related to estrogen or androgen content
benefits.summary: Maca (3.5 g/d) reduces psychological symptoms, including anxiety and depression, and lowers measures of sexual dysfunction in postmenopausal women independent of estrogenic and androgenic activity.

benefits.title: A Double‐Blind, Randomized, Pilot Dose‐Finding Study of Maca Root (L. Meyenii) for the Management of SSRI‐Induced Sexual Dysfunction
benefits.summary: Maca root may alleviate SSRI-induced sexual dysfunction and have a beneficial effect on libido.

benefits.title: A pilot investigation into the effect of maca supplementation on physical activity and sexual desire in sportsmen.
benefits.summary: Maca supplementation improved 40 km cycling time trial performance and sexual desire in trained male cyclists.

benefits.title: Effect of Lepidium meyenii Walp. on Semen Parameters and Serum Hormone Levels in Healthy Adult Men: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled Pilot Study
benefits.summary: Maca possesses fertility enhancing properties in men, with rising trends in sperm concentration and motility.
benefits.journal: Evidence-based Complementary and Alternative Medicine : eCAM

benefits.title: Cyclophosphamide‐induced male subfertility in mice: An assessment of the potential benefits of Maca supplement
benefits.summary: Maca mitigates CYP-induced male gonadal toxicity and subfertility in mice.

benefits.title: Lepidium meyenii (Maca) enhances the serum levels of luteinising hormone in female rats.
benefits.summary: Maca enhances serum levels of luteinizing hormone in female rats during the pro-oestrus LH surge, supporting its traditional use for enhancing fertility.

benefits.title: Effect of short-term and long-term treatments with three ecotypes of Lepidium meyenii (MACA) on spermatogenesis in rats.
benefits.summary: Black Maca has a more beneficial effect on sperm counts and epididymal sperm motility than Yellow and Red Maca.

benefits.title: Discovering anti-osteoporosis constituents of maca (Lepidium meyenii) by combined virtual screening and activity verification
benefits.summary: Maca's active constituent, N-benzyl-palmitamide, prevents osteoporosis and promotes bone formation through enhanced expression of osteogenesis-related genes.

benefits.title: N-Benzyl-linoleamide, a Constituent of Lepidium meyenii (Maca), Is an Orally Bioavailable Soluble Epoxide Hydrolase Inhibitor That Alleviates Inflammatory Pain.
benefits.summary: Maca's constituent, N-benzyl-linoleamide, effectively reduces inflammatory pain.

benefits.title: The benefits of Maca (Lepidium meyenii) extract administration for male rabbits affected by environmental heat stress.
benefits.summary: Oral administration of Maca extract at 400 or 600 mg/head-weekly enhanced growth performance, hemato-biochemical attributes, antioxidant status, and semen quality in rabbits during the hot season.
benefits.journal: Journal of animal physiology and animal nutrition

side effects.title: Lepidium meyenii (Maca) in male reproduction
side effects.summary: Maca has been shown to affect the quality and quantity of semen, sexual behavior, and disorders of the male genital tract.

side effects.title: [Maca (Lepidium meyenii Walp), a review of its biological properties].
side effects.summary: Maca has diverse beneficial effects, including improved sexual function, spermatogenesis, female reproductive function, memory, depression, anxiety, energy, and safety in consumption.
side effects.journal: Revista peruana de medicina experimental y salud publica

side effects.title: Adverse effects of gentamicin in scarlet macaws and galahs.
side effects.summary: Gentamicin administration in macaws and galahs led to polydipsia, polyuria, and increased plasma aspartate transaminase activity.

side effects.title: Effect of Lepidium meyenii Walp. on Semen Parameters and Serum Hormone Levels in Healthy Adult Men: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled Pilot Study
side effects.summary: Maca possesses fertility enhancing properties in men, with rising trends in sperm concentration and motility.
side effects.journal: Evidence-based Complementary and Alternative Medicine : eCAM

side effects.title: Chemical composition and health effects of maca (Lepidium meyenii).
side effects.summary: Maca has diverse health effects, including enhanced reproductive health, antifatigue, antioxidation, neuroprotection, antimicrobial activity, anticancer, hepatoprotection, immunomodulation, and improving skin health and digestive system function.

side effects.title: Effect of Lepidium meyenii (Maca), a root with aphrodisiac and fertility-enhancing properties, on serum reproductive hormone levels in adult healthy men.
side effects.summary: Maca treatment does not affect serum reproductive hormone levels in adult healthy men.

side effects.title: Effect of maca supplementation on bovine sperm quantity and quality followed over two spermatogenic cycles.
side effects.summary: Maca supplementation improves sperm quantity and quality in bulls, but does not affect mating behavior.

side effects.title: Effect of Lepidium meyenii (Maca) on spermatogenesis in male rats acutely exposed to high altitude (4340 m).
side effects.summary: Maca treatment increased sperm count and prevented high altitude-induced testicular disturbances in male rats.

side effects.title: Acceptability, Safety, and Efficacy of Oral Administration of Extracts of Black or Red Maca (Lepidium meyenii) in Adult Human Subjects: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study
side effects.summary: Maca extract consumption improved quality of life parameters and was well tolerated and safe.

side effects.title: Subjective effects of Lepidium meyenii (Maca) extract on well‐being and sexual performances in patients with mild erectile dysfunction: a randomised, double‐blind clinical trial
side effects.summary: Maca supplementation has a small but significant effect on subjective perception of general and sexual well-being in adult patients with mild erectile dysfunction.

dosage.title: Effect of Lepidium meyenii (Maca), a root with aphrodisiac and fertility-enhancing properties, on serum reproductive hormone levels in adult healthy men.
dosage.summary: Maca dosages of 1500 mg or 3000 mg per day did not affect serum reproductive hormone levels in healthy men.

dosage.title: Beneficial effects of Lepidium meyenii (Maca) on psychological symptoms and measures of sexual dysfunction in postmenopausal women are not related to estrogen or androgen content
dosage.summary: Maca (3.5 g/d) reduces psychological symptoms and lowers sexual dysfunction in postmenopausal women independent of estrogenic and androgenic activity.

dosage.title: A Double‐Blind, Randomized, Pilot Dose‐Finding Study of Maca Root (L. Meyenii) for the Management of SSRI‐Induced Sexual Dysfunction
dosage.summary: Maca root may alleviate SSRI-induced sexual dysfunction at a dose of 3.0 g/day, with a dose-related effect on libido.

dosage.title: Subjective effects of Lepidium meyenii (Maca) extract on well‐being and sexual performances in patients with mild erectile dysfunction: a randomised, double‐blind clinical trial
dosage.summary: Maca dry extract, 2400 mg, significantly improves subjective perception of general and sexual well-being in adult patients with mild erectile dysfunction.

dosage.title: Cyclophosphamide‐induced male subfertility in mice: An assessment of the potential benefits of Maca supplement
dosage.summary: Oral Maca (500 or 1,000 mg/kg) mitigated CYP-induced gonadal toxicity and subfertility in male mice.

dosage.title: Lepidium meyenii Walp. improves sexual behaviour in male rats independently from its action on spontaneous locomotor activity.
dosage.summary: Acute and chronic Maca oral administration (15 mg/kg) significantly improve sexual performance parameters in male rats.

dosage.title: Effect of Lepidium meyenii (Maca) on spermatogenesis in male rats acutely exposed to high altitude (4340 m).
dosage.summary: Maca treatment (666.6 mg/day) prevented high altitude-induced testicular disturbances and increased sperm count in male rats.

dosage.title: Dose-response effects of Lepidium meyenii (Maca) aqueous extract on testicular function and weight of different organs in adult rats.
dosage.summary: Maca extract at doses up to 5 g/kg was safe and had a higher effect on reproductive parameters at a dose of 1 g extract/kg corresponding to 2.2 g dry Maca hypocotyls/kg.

dosage.title: Effect of Maca Extracts on Alleviating Physical Fatigue in Mice
dosage.summary: Maca extracts at a high dosage of 0.80 g/(kgbwd) significantly prolonged weight-loaded swimming duration and decreased blood urea nitrogen and blood lactic acid in mice.

dosage.title: Effect of Lepidium meyenii (MACA) on sexual desire and its absent relationship with serum testosterone levels in adult healthy men
dosage.summary: Maca was administered in doses of 1500 mg or 3000 mg to men aged 21-56 years.
